snippet: Women’s advocacy groups in France said the failure to more severely punish defendants in the gang rapes of two teenage girls would discourage other victims from seeking justice.
abstract: French jury hands down light sentences and acquittals in closely watched gang-rape case, prompting outrage from women’s advocacy groups and consternation from government ministers; 10 of 14 defendants, all minors at time crimes were said to have occurred, are acquitted; two are given one year in prison, a third six months and the fourth a suspended sentence.
lead_paragraph: Women’s advocacy groups in France said the failure to more severely punish defendants in the gang rapes of two teenage girls would discourage other victims from seeking justice.

headline.seo: In France, Light Gang Rape Penalties Prompt Outcry
headline.main: Light Gang Rape Penalties Provoke Outcry in France
headline.print_headline: Light Gang-Rape Penalties Provoke Outcry in France
